DOC.brief_summary: This study cross-sectional study investigate impact assistive force apply body-weight support system `` FLOAT '' study participant . The study conduct University Hospital Balgrist Zurich period around 3 year . During time measurement approximately 120 able body subject 20 patient incomplete spinal cord injury take place . The study participant invite single visit around 140 min duration University Hospital Balgrist . During visit study participant repeatedly perform various activity daily live ( free walking , stand sit , stair climb balance ) without assistive force body-weight support system . While perform task , study participant ' motion muscle activity measure evaluate naturalness movement . In addition , collect data permit u compare different movement pattern make conclusion effective optimal movement support . Obtaining knowledge help u shape therapy activity tailor patient train movement help FLOAT optimal condition .
DOC.brief_title: Impact Assistive Forces Activities Daily Living
